intro: Cirrhopetalum sikkimense, commonly known as the Sikkim cirrhopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often found in montane forests. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
